continuously_h.intro1helpTxt: The Axis product can be configured to continuously save video to a SD Card or to a Network attached storage (NAS). Configure continuous recordings for different stream profiles.
continuously_h.intro2helpTxt: The Axis product can be configured to continuously save video to a SD Card. Configure continuous recordings for different stream profiles.
continuously_h.intro2helpTxt-1: The Axis product can be configured to continuously save video to a storage device. Go to Setup > System Options > Storage for more information about storage devices. Configure continuous recordings for different stream profiles.
continuously_h.recSethelpTxt1: Enable - Must be checked to record continuously.
continuously_h.recSethelpTxt2: Storage - Select a storage from the drop-down list to save the continuous recording to.
continuously_h.selectDisk_Txt: Storage - Type of storage for saving continuous recordings.
continuously_h.recSethelpTxt3: Stream Profile - Select a stream profile to record in.
continuously_h.recSethelpTxt4: The new settings will not take place until Save is clicked.
continuously_h.recSethelpTxt5: Note: When Storage or Stream profile is changed, the recording will be stopped and a new recording using the new settings will be started.
continuously_h.recSethelpTxt6: Start time - Shows the time the current continuous recording began. If no continuous recording is taking place the status will show as Not started.
continuously_h.recSethelpTxt7: Duration - Shows the length of the current continuous recording.
continuously_h.recSethelpTxt8: Restart - Click Restart to start a new recording.
continuously_h.recSethelpTxt9: Note: All previous continuous recording data will be removed.
continuously_h.recSethelpTxt10: From - To play or download the recording from a point in time, enter the year, month, day and the time in hours and minutes. The time set here is also used for naming the file, see Download.
continuously_h.recSethelpTxt11: Duration - Enter the amount of the recording to play or download in hours and minutes.
continuously_h.recSethelpTxt12: Play - Click this button to open a window to play the selected amount of the continuous recording.
continuously_h.recSethelpTxt13: Download - Click this button to download the recorded video to a storage disk. The package downloaded is a zip file containing a minimum of 3 files, of which the .mkv or Matroska file is the actual recording.
continuously_h.recSethelpTxt14: Note: To play recordings in Windows Media Player download and install AXIS Matroska File Splitter from www.axis.com/techsup/software/
continuously_h.recSethelpTxt15: The Matroska files have the format BlockID.mkv and are placed in a directory with the format YYYYMMDD/HH/RecordingID/YYYYMMDD_HH/ time where:
continuously_h.recSethelpTxt20: RecordingID - Each recording is given a unique ID.
continuously_h.recSethelpTxt21: BlockID - Depending on its length, a recording can contain one or more blocks in 5 minute increments. BlockID is the unique ID given to the specific block.
continuously_h.recSethelpTxt22: The two remaining files are intended for developer partners. For more information go to www.axis.com/developer

playWindow_h.snapshot_AMC_Txt1: Clicking the Snapshot button saves a JPEG snapshot of the image currently being displayed in the video stream.
playWindow_h.snapshot_AMC_Txt2: Note that the Snapshot function's behaviour and the target directory for saving snapshots can be configured from the AXIS Media Control applet, which is opened from the Windows Control Panel, or by right-clicking in the image and selecting Settings.
playWindow_h.fullscreen_Txt: Clicking the View Full Screen button causes the playback image to fill the entire screen area. No other windows will be visible. Press the 'Esc' button on the computer keyboard to cancel full screen view.
playWindow_h.mpeg_rec_Txt1: Click the Start recording button to make a recording. Click again to stop the recording.
playWindow_h.mpeg_rec_Txt2: Recording settings can be modified from the AXIS Media Control applet, which is opened from the Windows Control Panel, or by right-clicking in the image and selecting Settings.
playWindow_h.play_stop_Txt: The Play/Stop button toggles start/stop of the recording.
playWindow_h.playfromstart_Txt: To start the playback at a certain point, enter the amount of time to skip from the beginning of the recording. Time is represented as HH:MM:SS. For example, to start the playback 10 minutes into the recording enter 00:10:00 and click the Play button.
playWindow_h.playbackSlider_Txt: The slide bar shows a point where playback has reached relative to the recording's length. The bar can also be used to move through the recording by clicking at any point on the slide bar or by dragging the slider. The slide bar is visible in Microsoft Internet Explorer only and when playing a recording using H.264 and MJPEG with audio. Note that, the slide bar is greyed out if the recording is ongoing.
playWindow_h.note: Note: When playing a recording using H.264, the Play/Stop button and the time field are visable in Microsoft Internet Explorer only.
Note: When playing a recording using H.264, the Play/Stop button and the time field are visible in Microsoft Internet Explorer only.
playWindow_h.note2: Note2: The playback will start at an I-frame when skipping forward using the Play from start field on H.264 recordings.
playWindow_h.play_download_Txt1: The Download button opens a file download dialog to save the recording and other information to a zip file.
playWindow_h.play_download_Txt2: Note: The file saved is named in the following format recording_YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.zip where:
playWindow_h.play_download_Txt9: The date represents when the file was saved and NOT the date of the recording. The zipped package contains a minimum of 3 files, of which the .mkv or Matroska file is the actual recording.
playWindow_h.play_download_Txt10: Note: To play recordings in Windows Media Player download and install AXIS Matroska File Splitter from
playWindow_h.play_download_Txt11: The Matroska files have the format BlockID.mkv and are placed in a directory with the format DiskID/YYYYMMDD/HH/RecordingID/YYYYMMDD_HH/ where:
playWindow_h.play_download_Txt13: RecordingID - Each recording is given a unique ID.
playWindow_h.play_download_Txt14: BlockID - Depending on its length, a recording can contain one or more blocks in 5 minute increments. BlockID is the unique ID given to the specific block.
playWindow_h.play_download_Txt15: The two remaining files are intended for developer partners. For more information go to
playWindow_h.export_button_Txt: To export a recording or part of a recording in a format that can be played on your device, click Export.
playWindow_h.heading: Recording Information
playWindow_h.text1: Under Recording information is listed the start/stop time and duration of the recording.

recordingList_h.intro: The Recording List window contains a list of recordings in the system. It shows each recording's start time, length and the event type used to start the recording.
recordingList_h.filter1: Use the filter to narrow down the list according to certain criteria such as a particular time frame.
recordingList_h.filter2: Note that certain filters, may take a long time to complete.
recordingList_h.filter3: Recording time - Filter out a group of recordings based on their start dates or times. The recording date and time is listed according to the device's time zone. If the local time zone is different than the device's time zone, you will need to consider that the filter is done by the device's time zone.
recordingList_h.filter4: From - The date and time a recording started. The following options are available from the drop down list:
recordingList_h.filter5: First recording - This is the default setting and is the same as selecting no start recording time.
recordingList_h.filter6: Today - The current date is automatically inserted.
recordingList_h.filter6-1: Today - The current date is automatically inserted. Note that, time inserted here will be the product's Current Server Time.
recordingList_h.filter18: Yesterday - The date from 1 day ago is automatically inserted.
recordingList_h.filter7: Last 7 days - The date from 7 days ago is automatically inserted.
recordingList_h.filter8: Last 30 days - The date from 30 days ago is automatically inserted.
recordingList_h.filter9: Date - Enter a date, time, or a date and time for when the recording started. The hour and minute (hh:mm) a recording started can be omitted but not the year and month (yyyy-mm).
recordingList_h.filter10: To - The date and time a recording was stopped. The following options are available from the drop down list:
recordingList_h.filter11: Now - This is the default setting. The current date and time are automatically inserted.
recordingList_h.filter11-1: Now - This is the default setting. The current date and time are automatically inserted. Note that, time inserted here will be the product's Current Server Time.
recordingList_h.filter12: Date - Enter a date, time, or a date and time for when the recording started. The hour and minute (hh:mm) a recording started can be omitted but not the year and month (yyyy-mm).
recordingList_h.filter13: Event - Select a group of recordings based on what type of event triggered the recording.
recordingList_h.filter14: Storage - Select a group of recordings based on where the recordings are stored.
recordingList_h.filter15: Sort - Select whether the filtered recording list should be sorted in ascending or descending order of start time.
recordingList_h.filter16: Results - Select how many recordings to list in the window at one time.
recordingList_h.filter17: Filter - Click the Filter button to generate the list under Recordings.
recordingList_h.recording1: The following is a description of the buttons located under the list of recordings.
recordingList_h.recording2: Play - Select one or more recordings and click Play... to open the playback window.
recordingList_h.recording3: Properties for detailed recording and video information.
recordingList_h.export_Txt: Export - click to export a recording or part of a recording in a format that can be played on your device. A recording must be selected before clicking Export.
recordingList_h.recording4: Download - The Download button opens a file download dialog to save the recording and other information to a zip file.
recordingList_h.recording5: Note: The file saved is named in the following format recording_YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.zip where:
recordingList_h.recording12: The date represents when the file was saved and NOT the date of the recording. The zipped package contains a minimum of 3 files, of which the .mkv or Matroska file is the actual recording.
recordingList_h.recording13: Note: To play recordings in Windows Media Player download and install AXIS Matroska File Splitter from
recordingList_h.recording14: The Matroska files have the format BlockID.mkv and are placed in a directory with the format DiskID/YYYYMMDD/HH/RecordingID/YYYYMMDD_HH/ where:
recordingList_h.recording16: RecordingID - Each recording is given a unique ID.
recordingList_h.recording17: BlockID - Depending on its length, a recording can contain one or more blocks in 5 minute increments. BlockID is the unique ID given to the specific block.
recordingList_h.recording18: Remove - To delete a recording, select it and click Remove.

recordingProperties_h.intro: The recording properties window provides more detailed recording and video property information than what is available for each recording in the Recording list window.
recordingProperties_h.heading: Recording
recordingProperties_h.textRecID_1: Recording ID - Each recording is given a unique identification number by the
recordingProperties_h.textDiskID: Disk ID - The recording is stored on the memory card with this disk identification.
recordingProperties_h.textStartTime: Start time - The date and time the recording began.
recordingProperties_h.textStop: Stop time - The date and time the recording stopped.
recordingProperties_h.textLength: Length - The length of the recording in hours:minutes:seconds.
recordingProperties_h.textTrig: Triggered by - The name of the event that triggered the recording.
recordingProperties_h.textRecType: Recording type - Shows if the recording was started by a triggered or scheduled event.
recordingProperties_h.textRecStatus: Recording status - If the recording has finished it will be inactive. If the recording is still ongoing, it will be listed as active.
recordingProperties_h.textVideotype: Video type - The video stream can be encoded as a Motion JPEG, MPEG-4, or H.264 file.
recordingProperties_h.textFramerate: Frame rate - Shows the frame rate or frames per second (fps) that was used during the recording.
recordingProperties_h.textRes: Resolution - The camera resolution used to make the recording.

exportRecording_h.intro_Txt: This page provides different options that can be used when exporting a recording.
exportRecording_h.recordingID_Txt: Recording ID - A unique ID for the recording.
exportRecording_h.diskID_Txt: Disk ID - Disk that a recording is saved in, for example, SD Card or Network Share.
exportRecording_h.startTime_Txt: Start time - The date and time a recording started. The allowed format is YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS, for example, 2013-09-24 09:28:11. If required to change recording start time, click within the field and type the date and time.
exportRecording_h.stopTime_Txt: Stop time - The date and time a recording ended. The allowed format is YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS, for example, 2013-09-24 09:29:17. If required to change recording stop time, click within the field and type the date and time.
exportRecording_h.expPartNote_Txt: Note - To export a playable part of the full recording, change the start and stop times as required.
exportRecording_h.fileSize_Txt: Estimated file size - Displays a recording's estimated file size. The file size is displayed as not available if the recording is ongoing. Refresh the page after few minutes to see the estimated file size.
exportRecording_h.fileFormat_Txt: File format - The file format for the exported recording.
exportRecording_h.fileName_Txt: File name - The file name for the exported recording. If the file name field is left empty, the exported file name will be in format Start time_Stop time.file extension, for example 20130924_102906_20130924_102918.mkv.
exportRecording_h.play_download_Txt10: Note: To play recordings in Windows Media Player download and install AXIS Matroska File Splitter from
